960D6728936C4B05ACD6B99E6DA92C64.description: Investigate arts expressions of First Nations and Métis artists whose work speaks to the relationship between people, the land, and environment.

D7A5A257943D4750A9E61EC9CDCD9868.description: Observe, listen to, and inquire about First Nations and Métis arts and protocols related to arts expressions.

0EAAEFB92F3144A6BC26598BB7280418.description: Recognize and describe distinctions between various arts styles (e.g., Métis fiddling vs. powwow music, round dance vs. jingle dance).

3A2A4FC324C1462B9BE3488F0BD2C932.description: Perform songs, music, and dances of various styles as appropriate (e.g., invite in community resource people to ensure protocols are followed).

E981C768700641F09A44C1AEAD7945CE.description: Describe, using own words, key features of arts expressions by Saskatchewan First Nations and Métis artists in own community and beyond.

E613C491AED3411C9A34083EE6A3FCE1.description: Share information about the arts expressions of Saskatchewan First Nations and Métis artists gained through individual research or collaborative inquiry.

5E34E579A3644D64BAECDF320E900DB7.description: Demonstrate an awareness of traditional and evolving arts expressions of Saskatchewan First Nations and Métis artists in own communities or regions.

5F380B91CE284578AAC17DD9A61017FB.description: Describe ways that people of various cultures in own and surrounding communities participate in the arts and discuss why they do so.

5DC69B2A0EF74896B0E83775214860B4.description: Describe how an arts expression tells something about the community and culture in which it was created (e.g., heritage harvest dances).

1429544C3F194335B64DA61FC5697082.description: Conduct research and guided Internet searches for information about Saskatchewan artists.

13123385F9674FBAB84D49AFDFC4EE9A.description: Share information about an artist working in own community through individual research or collaborative inquiry.

60315FD7BCA24360A48389A497F20039.description: Investigate many different kinds of arts expressions.

FEFC6D923F9D42DE9F69A92A91E73FAB.description: Compare how arts expressions from various groups and communities may be a reflection of their unique environment (e.g., North and South Saskatchewan, urban and rural).

6C78503DCEAD411EBE4748AC3D9BE4DE.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) - Children will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and understand the connection between the arts and human experience.

071E620FAF49408B9B90357B326D7D45.description: Respond to arts expressions in various ways such as verbally, through movement, music, or drawing.

096B19C782334AE1AD447AE7B01633BE.description: Create an arts expression in response to, or in the same style as, a professional artist and identify connections to the original work.

211DD5BB4956413CAAE8F11159F777D4.description: Discuss with peers varying interpretations of the same arts expression, recognizing that not everyone responds the same way.

F181FE4BBC62492A8E8987CF1FF55E7C.description: Use own words to demonstrate awareness of arts languages and creative processes.

F4F1FCA2218C4FA6B03FD32DCDBC3B2F.description: Demonstrate ways that arts expressions can represent ideas and convey meaning verbally and non-verbally (e.g., music that conveys a mood; dance that conveys ideas about bullying; drama that conveys ideas about compassion; visual art work or graphic that conveys a social message).

91559E953CCD4AA8A119929E7D76BA6C.description: Respond to arts expressions that use the environment (natural, constructed, imagined) as inspiration.

6D6388D8315D4A378ACAB502FE3404AE.description: Discuss own and group inquiry and creative problem-solving processes (e.g., the paint kept getting muddy so I cleaned my brush more often; the troll was bossy in the beginning; my partner and I thought it would look better if we jumped at the same time; we couldn’t hear the voices so we played softer).

14EC65568EFD48988883CE5C24BA50FB.description: Discuss ideas for own arts expressions incorporating personal interests and experience.

016468F0C6DF478FBB4713FD6753DDF8.description: Identify and describe how arts expressions make them think and feel.

3C2BA3CB2BA248BBB9E31A064F279B54.description: Describe ideas and problem-solving processes used in own arts expressions.

C2FC5A9CFC7D4F218B1AA18E2AB241F7.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) - Children will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian, and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity, and collaborative inquiry

186D1B45EEA7483DA4357450A7E5E4CB.description: Identify examples of contrast in own surroundings and in art works

31D5B7DA84D343939F3B2A26D5325A9A.description: Identify formal and informal patterns in own surroundings and art works.

3880E6257E8542E0A1951BC2C4122FB9.description: Recognize cubes, cylinders, and spheres as geometric forms and apply this knowledge to art work.

08F99650D8984253B8E07D7078072875.description: Recognize circles, squares, triangles, and rectangles as geometric shapes and apply this knowledge to art work.

5F445E1074464311BFC86182FF8D326C.description: Use three-dimensional materials such as clay to create real textures.

9685DD8A9EF64405BC4853397E9344C2.description: Demonstrate ways to change a colour’s value by adding white or black.

9ACC9817F1CD4916894115E3C02CF533.description: Investigate relationships of colours on the colour wheel.

78A60A8B669E497491E20A1FAA36119A.description: Apply understanding of contour lines to form the outline of an object.

100CB181B4DC4CE5A4BBB571076527FB.description: Observe visual details, and include details to enhance depictions of animals, people, and objects.

0BAF6C736EED4CF698AF1FB17A4DBB3C.description: Create art works using a variety of visual art concepts (e.g., contour lines), forms (e.g., drawing, sculpture), and media (e.g., pencils, pastels, found objects).

99B1DDBF89B44EDEA47A88B5BFBD2528.description: Use guided Internet searches to investigate how artists use different art forms and media to express their ideas.

FEB1BBCF8C1940DB9D66C87BBF2494BE.description: Discuss how the plan and visual exploration is evolving, and adjust decisions accordingly.

2F5DE64100E847719D5035E14EC43B9D.description: Explore inquiry questions visually (e.g., What are some unique characteristics of plant growth? How could we create our own representations of plant growth using different styles of art?).

C446ACD9F25741DE828F24155E5266EA.description: Use guided Internet searches to investigate how artists represent the environment in different ways.

BEE56C2B3CEE481B804D5939936AF055.description: Develop a plan to visually explore selected question(s) (e.g., observe and draw, gather research information, imagine and paint).

8EC07D150A18429987DCB76AC131D5D4.description: Generate questions that arise from the investigation of a topic or area of interest to initiate inquiry (e.g., How have different artists represented plant life in visual art works and book illustrations?).

1290AAEEE89345BE9586AA90461EF945.description: Create visual art works that express ideas about the natural, constructed, and imagined environments.

091345D39D044CD3A53028FE953EC0E4.description: Explore and differentiate between different timbres of instruments.

38251E62E02A44CBA3FF643132A7FA14.description: Investigate ways of creating texture in music (i.e., the combining and layering of sounds that creates the fabric or texture of music).

33A67B4BF6B94ED5A26345DB3423594E.description: Investigate ways of combining pitch and rhythm to form melody in music.

F4B1E7D081FE4477B0EBD8C6D1324757.description: Demonstrate and apply understanding of rhythm and patterns of duration (i.e., groupings of longer and shorter sounds and silences).

0F3D99A177AD4A41A3225BBBEEDBD814.description: Demonstrate and apply understanding of dynamics recognizing that sounds may differ in levels of loud/soft (dynamics) in speech and music.

B1F887B28D9A47489B0FE8626E914A9C.description: Apply understanding of tempo recognizing that music may move relatively fast or slow.

E6448F745B154E49A23331ADE5B6CDD3.description: Investigate questions arising from inquiry into the elements of music and form (e.g., How many different ways can we play that same pattern?).

70C8FBE2A3704FFFA947A760BDA800F0.description: Imitate and create repeated and contrasting rhythmic phrases in simple metres (e.g., 2/4, 4/4).

7175B5A766B54F2AB359EE7AD52B6DE5.description: Investigate how beats are/can be systematically grouped into twos, threes, and combinations and multiples of twos and threes.

EE8D987B1293440F904A52805B33E68D.description: Create rhythmic and/or vocal answers to rhythmic and/or vocal questions (call and response).

FBF0473D43AA4C8A8A3FE8B0D8D7F7CE.description: Create and perform music (vocal and instrumental) that demonstrates knowledge of: form (repeated or contrasting phrases: call/ response, question/answer, rounds), rhythm (interplay of beat, tempo, and patterns of duration), pitch (combining pitch and rhythm to form melody), dynamics (levels of loud/ soft), texture (combining and layering sounds) and tone colour (differentiate).

C72AE9498031444AA9965C45E7829B56.description: Record own sound compositions using simple representations of the sounds (e.g., drawings, invented or traditional notation).

C59E874BD1B440B5B52CCE4E21761A17.description: Improvise melodic phrases to represent different ideas about the environment.

1695581AFF354A199581CB2F43B5298C.description: Experiment with contrasting tempos and dynamics to represent different ideas about the environment.

AD380714F25C47BB99B555D6578F9149.description: Create vocal and instrumental compositions, and investigate questions and music concepts through collaborative inquiry (e.g., How could we represent the mood or feeling of that environment in our music composition? How could we combine our voices and these instruments to represent the change in the weather? How could we play this part of the composition to better represent an approaching storm?).

6D8CD36329B94D5AB2070F5F0AB294C3.description: Match pitch, and sing grade-appropriate songs with accurate rhythm and expression.

303B07EB36E9454685A94D470DF7719D.description: Play a variety of sound objects and instruments with expression.

C35C00E93D14492DA500AD0E0590EAA7.description: Make considered choices to express ideas using a variety of sound objects and instruments.

35D4344A1D3C4D45967748528668F2A4.description: Demonstrate basic skills in use of voice and a variety of sound objects and instruments (traditional and/or homemade) using the environment (e.g., natural, constructed, imagined) as inspiration.

1880EBE597444C7E8C7DE1F0F05B1815.description: Demonstrate confidence in using a variety of strategies within dramatic situations.

D53CBD46A6504D0A9BEABFBA42A86B1C.description: Use imagination to explore various possibilities in dramatic contexts.

012F8C2F03A7437AB49A2734D01F46FF.description: Demonstrate respect for the contributions of others.

3B1F44AC06734399978F3CAC81283677.description: Listen at all times within a drama and discuss how this behaviour contributes to the drama’s success.

8DA21EF994B24ADFB970E33592EF998A.description: Ask questions to contribute to inquiry of the topic through drama (e.g., What could we do to find out how different people would feel and react in that situation?).

4D8D931CAF7C4D98879A00DB8BDA6137.description: Support contributions to drama discussions with stories of own or community experience.

BF4CB30286D84C10B775AA11F7911BF5.description: Use imagination, a variety of drama strategies, and reflection to further the drama’s development.

0BB56D6139CA4ECE926008FB9C31D602.description: Use language purposefully when speaking and writing in role.

9F90B4256DDB4AF28A937E6E4D6429DD.description: Respond appropriately and imaginatively to others in role to further the dramatic work.

080BCB4180F448C7A35E41BCAB71959D.description: Demonstrate ability to maintain a role throughout one or more dramatic episodes.

4FC89BFA8BA4430A8B7B868985E13B81.description: Demonstrate commitment to roles and the fiction represented in the dramatic situation (i.e., suspend disbelief).

41A6033209CE4A27A76A31889F62CF8C.description: Sustain roles in dramatic situations and accept/respond to others in role, using the environment (e.g., natural, constructed, imagined) as inspiration.

146B18F3CA5D4D45A2A8AC5186F9DCCB.description: Create and recall a variety of combinations of straight and curved pathways on the floor, and illustrate differences

2222393487BD48C6AA2375EFE9B01277.description: Apply a range of relationships to dance compositions (e.g., beside, above, in front, behind).

CD2907C9FE0B47AE89A13EC82C62FF97.description: Demonstrate ways of grouping speed and duration to form rhythmic patterns.

3583515A51F845E8841C1191CAB14A89.description: Demonstrate that energy is on a continuum of a little to a lot and apply to own movement explorations and dances.

981BDDC618C149C792233E84DE51B756.description: Apply a variety of dynamics including moving with the extremes of speed (fast and slow), duration (short and long), and varying forces (strong and light).

9EFD4C70BE94467BA1E6E0DFFA9455D6.description: Apply a wide variety of actions including the five basic jumps of leap, hop, jump (from two feet to land on two feet), sissone (from two feet to land on one foot), and assemble (from one foot to land on two feet).

F8DB898958514AFE99002484071BF1EA.description: Apply knowledge of body zones including right side, left side, front, back, upper half, and lower half to own movements.

B3A30D0B53C441BC85C575D5DA963B9F.description: Generate movements in order to represent own movement ideas.

D8D632B549A24857914A33AE85BF23A2.description: Create dance phrases and sequences that demonstrate understanding of the elements of dance including: actions (five basic jumps), body (zones and areas), dynamics (extremes of speed, duration, varying forces), relationships (range) and space (create and recall combinations of pathways and directions).

30314E7C80BD49CAABDC8B10F3BB5CD5.description: Combine movements into dance phrases that have a beginning position, a middle, and end position.

3E03AB81EEF84A56BBF260F65E258CF7.description: Reflect on which movements worked best and adjust own work accordingly.

8C8280D231E445B3A256C315BE43AA39.description: Generate a range of alternatives for representing movement ideas and solving movement problems.

D6D778D1DA0F458EB15601D24DDB43A3.description: Create a wide variety of movements to a given stimuli.

F8575FF9FBDC4B6587E37339003BCFA7.description: Ask questions about the stimuli to contribute to dance-making inquiry (e.g., How else could we represent that same feeling in movement?).

BA154D3AAB7944EC87C93202A4F03D71.description: Generate ideas for stimuli as starting points for dance compositions (e.g., plant growth in science, lines in a poem, music, personal experience, tradition, memory).

F2B9E01A36714A71B1BE9884021AC9EE.description: Generate a variety of alternatives and solutions in movement explorations (improvisation) using the environment (e.g., natural, constructed, imagined) as stimuli.

727A28B78935413C8D89B06D4A05E096.description: Creative/Productive (CP) - Children will inquire, create, and communicate through dance, drama, music, and visual art.
